title: 90/218/EEC: Council Decision of 25 April 1990 concerning the administration of Bovine Somatotrophin (BST)
header:
COUNCIL  DECISION
of 25 April 1990
concerning the administration of Bovine Somatotrophin (BST)
(90/218/EEC)
THE COUNCIL OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body: Notwithstanding the scientific and technical examination of applications laid down by Community rules, Member States shall, until 31 December 1990, prohibit the administration of Bovine Somatotrophin on their territory by any means whatsoever to dairy cows.

By way of derogation from Article 1, Member States may authorize the administration to dairy cows of Bovine Somatotrophin for the purposes of carrying out scientific and technical trials, subject to strictly controlled conditions to be notified to the Commission.
On a proposal from the Commission, the Council may, acting by a qualified majority, adopt measures necessary for the uniform application of this Decision.

The Commission shall, before 1 October 1990, submit a report to the European Parliament and to the Council on the situation, accompanied by proposals concerning future arrangements. The Council shall decide before 31 December 1990 on such proposals.
This Decision is addressed to the Member States.
attachments:
Done at Brussels, 25 April 1990.
For the Council
The President
M. O'KENNEDY
